sense.name: make or become taut or not loose
sense.commentary: Note: Usually concrete or physical usages
sense.examples: The Jell-O never firmed up, even when bordered by beautiful lettuce. Like other muscles they can be firmed up by exercise. The loose teeth had firmed, the gums have a pink, healthy color.

sense.name: stabilize, make or become more stronger, more solid
sense.commentary: Note: Usually abstract or metaphorical usages
sense.examples: We have firmed up plans of entering power and energy industries. The challenge has only firmed up her resolve. So I lied about the beanpot schedule; it never really firmed up, and I am slow to update.
